item.title: 欧洲央行将再次降息，夏季暂停的理由不断增强
item.description: 欧洲中央银行几乎肯定会在周四再次降息，并在随后的会议上保留所有选项，即使暂停其长达一年的宽松周期的理由越来越充分。【原文：The European Central Bank is almost certain to cut interest rates again on Thursday and keep all options on the table for subsequent meetings, even as the case grows for a pause in its year-long easing cycle.】

item.title: 稳定币发行商 Circle 在美国首次公开募股中融资 10.5 亿美元
item.description: Circle Internet 周三将其美国首次公开募股定价提高到每股 31 美元，共募集资金 10.5 亿美元，为越来越多的后期加密货币公司瞄准公开市场增添了新的动力。【原文：Circle Internet on Wednesday priced its upsized U.S. initial public offering at $31 apiece raising $1.05 billion, adding fresh momentum to a growing pipeline of late-stage cryptocurrency firms eyeing public markets.】

item.title: DoorDash、Grubhub、Uber Eats 就收费上限问题与纽约市达成和解
item.description: DoorDash、Grubhub 和 Uber Eats 已就纽约市一项限制餐馆送餐收费的法律达成和解。【原文：DoorDash , Grubhub and Uber Eats have settled a lawsuit against New York City over a law capping how much they can charge restaurants for delivering meals.】

item.title: 苹果公司在 Epic Games 案中申请暂停应用商店改革令败诉
item.description: 苹果公司未能说服美国上诉法院暂停联邦法官要求这家 iPhone 制造商立即向更多竞争对手开放其利润丰厚的 App Store 的命令的关键部分。【原文：Apple has failed to persuade a U.S. appeals court to pause key parts of a federal judge's order requiring the iPhone maker to immediately open its lucrative App Store to more competition.】

item.title: 交易日：特氟龙股票走高
item.description: 了解推动全球市场的各种力量。【原文：Making sense of the forces driving global markets.】

item.title: 据彭博社报道，中国黑客入侵美国电信系统的时间早于此前已知的时间
item.description: 据彭博新闻社（Bloomberg News）周三报道，企业调查人员发现了中国黑客于 2023 年夏天入侵一家美国电信公司的证据，表明黑客入侵美国通信系统的时间早于此前已知的时间。【原文：Corporate investigators found evidence that Chinese hackers broke into a U.S. telecommunications company in the summer of 2023, indicating the hackers penetrated the U.S. communications system earlier than previously known, Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 亚马逊的配送和物流将获得人工智能的助力
item.description: 亚马逊希望顾客知道，人工智能不仅仅是用来写大学论文的。【原文：Amazon wants customers to know that artificial intelligence is not just for writing college essays.】

item.title: 星巴克任命迈克-格拉姆斯（Mike Grams）为运营总监，进行高层调整以促进业务发展
item.description: 星巴克首席执行官布莱恩-尼科尔（Brian Niccol）周三表示，北美首席门店官迈克-格拉姆斯（Mike Grams）现在将担任星巴克咖啡连锁店的首席运营官。【原文：Starbucks CEO Brian Niccol said on Wednesday North America chief stores officer Mike Grams would now be the chief operating officer of the coffee chain.】

item.title: 墨西哥石油公司重组两年将节省 2.5 亿美元
item.description: 世界上负债最多的能源公司墨西哥石油公司（Pemex）周三表示，作为机构重组的一部分，该公司计划在未来两年内节约 48 亿比索（约合 2.5004 亿美元）。【原文：Mexico's Pemex, the world's most indebted energy company, said on Wednesday that it plans to save 4.8 billion pesos ($250.04 million) over the next two years as part of an institutional reorganization.】

item.title: Reddit 起诉人工智能初创公司 Anthropic，指控其未经许可使用数据
item.description: Reddit 周三起诉人工智能初创公司 Anthropic，指控该公司从社交媒体讨论网站窃取数据来训练其人工智能模型，尽管该公司曾公开保证不会这样做。【原文：Reddit sued the artificial intelligence startup Anthropic on Wednesday, accusing it of stealing data from the social media discussion website to train its AI models despite publicly assuring it wouldn't.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，耶鲁接近达成出售 25 亿美元私募股权的交易
item.description: 据彭博新闻社（Bloomberg News）周三报道，耶鲁大学正在敲定出售其最多达 25 亿美元的私募股权和风险投资资产。【原文：Yale University is finalizing the sale of up to $2.5 billion of its private equity and venture capital assets, Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 谷歌与智利签署跨太平洋海底光缆部署协议
item.description: Alphabet 旗下的谷歌公司在周三的一次会议上与智利政府签署了一项协议，将部署一条横跨太平洋、连接澳大利亚和亚洲的海底数据电缆，全长 14,800 公里（9,196 英里），计划于 2027 年投入使用。【原文：Alphabet's Google signed an agreement with the Chilean government during a meeting on Wednesday to deploy a 14,800-kilometer (9,196-mile) submarine data cable across the Pacific Ocean to connect with Australia and Asia, set to be operational by 2027.】

item.title: 监管机构解除处罚，富国银行首席执行官从修补者变为建设者
item.description: 富国银行首席执行官查理-沙尔夫（Charlie Scharf）知道自己一向以严厉著称，但他说，当周二该银行最终被监管机构取消 1.95 万亿美元的资产上限时，他变得情绪激动。【原文：Wells Fargo CEO Charlie Scharf knows he has a reputation for sternness, but he said that when the bank was finally freed of a $1.95 trillion asset cap by regulators on Tuesday, he became emotional.】

item.title: 美联储：关税施压物价，美国经济活动下滑
item.description: 美国中央银行周三在其最新一期国家经济快报中表示，自美联储决策者上次开会确定利率以来的几周内，美国经济活动有所下降，关税税率的提高给成本和价格带来了上升压力。【原文：U.S. economic activity has declined and higher tariff rates have put upward pressure on costs and prices in the weeks since Federal Reserve policymakers last met to set interest rates, the U.S. central bank said on Wednesday in its latest snapshot of the nation's economy.】

item.title: 消息人士称，杰富瑞聘请拉扎德的托马斯为激进主义辩护
item.description: 周三，随着越来越多的公司面临激进投资者的压力，杰富瑞聘请了拉扎德（Lazard）的一位资深银行家担任该公司激进主义防御业务的全球主管。【原文：Jefferies has hired a veteran Lazard banker as global head of the firm's activism defense practice, people familiar with the situation said on Wednesday, as more corporations face pressure from activist investors.】

item.title: 力拓修订塞尔维亚锂项目成本
item.description: 贾达尔锂矿总经理查德-布勒维特（Chad Blewitt）周三表示，力拓正在修订其塞尔维亚锂矿项目的成本，该项目被欧盟委员会确定为13个战略性新关键材料项目之一。【原文：Rio Tinto is revising the cost of its Serbian lithium project that the European Commission identified as one of 13 strategic new critical material projects, Chad Blewitt, managing director of the Jadar lithium mine, said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 数据显示，到 2029 年，人工智能驱动的搜索广告支出将激增至 260 亿美元
item.description: Emarketer周三发布的数据显示，在人工智能技术的快速应用和更复杂的用户定位的推动下，美国人工智能搜索广告的支出将从今年的略高于10亿美元激增至2029年的近260亿美元。【原文：Spending on AI-powered search advertising is poised to surge to nearly $26 billion by 2029 from just over $1 billion this year in the U.S., driven by rapid adoption of the technology and more sophisticated user targeting, data from Emarketer showed on Wednesday.】

item.title: 企业产品公司称美国将拒绝向中国出口三批乙烷货物
item.description: Enterprise Products Partners 周三表示，该公司收到通知，美国商务部打算拒绝其向中国出口三批乙烷的申请，总计约 220 万桶。【原文：Enterprise Products Partners said on Wednesday it received notice that the U.S. Commerce Department intends to deny its requests to export three proposed cargoes of ethane, totaling around 2.2 million barrels, to China.】

item.title: 巴西 Pix 公司推出循环支付，实现下一次飞跃
item.description: 巴西央行官员周三表示，巴西广受欢迎的即时支付系统 Pix 将于本月推出一项新的经常性支付功能，从而实现又一次飞跃。【原文：Brazil's wildly popular instant payment system Pix is poised for another leap with the launch of a new recurring payments feature this month, central bank officials said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》称，特朗普时代的招聘冻结损害了美国通胀数据的收集工作
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周三报道，由于特朗普政府冻结招聘，联邦政府人手短缺，迫使劳工部经济统计部门缩减了美国通胀主要衡量指标之一的数据收集范围。【原文：Federal government staffing shortages from Trump administration hiring freezes have forced the Labor Department's economic statistics arm to curtail the breadth of its data collection for one of the main measures of U.S. inflation, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 蒂森克虏伯将向股东分拆防务部门 TKMS 49% 的股份
item.description: 蒂森克虏伯的一位董事会成员周三表示，作为今年晚些时候上市的一部分，蒂森克虏伯计划将其防务部门 TKMS 的 49% 分拆给股东。【原文：Thyssenkrupp plans to spin off 49% of its defence division TKMS to shareholders as part of a listing later in the year, a board member of the German conglomerate said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 巴西可口可乐生产商的工厂因可能受到污染而暂停生产
item.description: 巴西政府周三表示，为可口可乐生产饮料的巴西软饮料公司索拉（Solar）旗下的一家工厂被检测出冷却系统出现故障，作为预防措施，该工厂暂停了生产和装瓶。【原文：A plant owned by Brazilian soft drink firm Solar, which produces for Coca-Cola , had a fault in its cooling system detected, leading production and bottling to be suspended as a precautionary measure, Brazil's government said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 共和党联邦通信委员会委员西明顿将于本周卸任
item.description: 共和党联邦通信委员会成员内森-西明顿（Nathan Simington）周三表示，他计划在任职四年多后于本周辞职。【原文：Republican Federal Communications Commission member Nathan Simington said Wednesday he plans to resign this week after more than four years in office.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚 5 月通胀可能放缓，但 2025 年全年通胀可能上升：路透社民意调查
item.description: 路透社周三的一项调查显示，由于食品成本压力减小和比索货币升值，哥伦比亚5月份的消费价格上涨可能略有放缓，但对2025年的通胀预期总体上有所增长。【原文：Colombia's consumer price increases likely slowed slightly in May thanks to reduced pressure on food costs and the appreciation of the peso currency, a Reuters survey showed on Wednesday, though inflation expectations for 2025 overall grew.】

item.title: 墨西哥将于周四重新批准新日铁与美国钢铁公司的合作-消息人士称
item.description: 据三位熟知内情的人士透露，墨西哥反垄断监管机构预计最快将于本周四重新批准新日铁以 149 亿美元收购美国钢铁公司（U.S. Steel）这一充满争议的交易，从而为这一合作扫除最后的障碍之一。【原文：Mexico's antitrust watchdog is expected to renew its approval of Nippon Steel's fraught $14.9 billion bid for U.S. Steel as soon as Thursday, according to three people familiar with the matter, removing one of the last remaining hurdles to the tie-up.】

item.title: 美国联邦航空局官员称目前不考虑取消波音 737 MAX 生产上限
item.description: 美国联邦航空管理局代理局长表示，他目前不考虑取消波音737 MAX飞机每月38架的生产上限，因为2024年1月阿拉斯加航空公司一架波音新飞机在空中发生紧急情况，缺少四个关键螺栓。【原文：The acting head of the Federal Aviation Administration said he is not currently considering lifting a production cap of 38 planes per month on Boeing's 737 MAX imposed after a January 2024 mid-air emergency involving a new Alaska Airlines Boeing plane missing four key bolts.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，SES 31 亿美元的通信卫星组织交易将获得欧盟无条件的反垄断批准
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士称，欧洲卫星公司 SES 出价 31 亿美元收购竞争对手 Intelsat 的交易将获得欧盟无条件的反垄断批准，从而在欧洲形成一个可与埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的 Space X 旗下 Starlink 公司相抗衡的主要竞争者。【原文：European satellite company SES is set to win unconditional EU antitrust approval for its $3.1-billion bid for rival Intelsat, people familiar with the matter said, creating a major European player to rival Elon Musk's Space X-owned Starlink.】

item.title: 美国国会预算办公室认为特朗普关税导致经济产出下降
item.description: 无党派的国会预算办公室周三表示，唐纳德-特朗普总统自5月13日起对外国商品征收的新关税将导致美国经济产出下降，同时也会使联邦预算赤字在十年内减少2.8万亿美元。【原文：U.S. economic output will fall as a result of President Donald Trump's new tariffs on foreign goods that were in place as of May 13, while also reducing federal budget deficits by $2.8 trillion over a decade, the non-partisan Congressional Budget Office said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 麦道夫客户收回 4.98 亿美元，赔付金额高达 150 亿美元
item.description: 根据周三与两家卢森堡基金清算人达成的和解协议，已故庞氏骗局策划者伯纳德-麦道夫的前客户将收回 4.983 亿美元，从而使他们收回的资金增至约 152.6 亿美元。【原文：Former customers of the late Ponzi schemer Bernard Madoff will recoup $498.3 million under a settlement on Wednesday with the liquidators of two Luxembourg funds, boosting their recovery to about $15.26 billion.】

item.title: 英国《金融时报》报道：苹果和阿里巴巴在中国推出人工智能的计划因特朗普的贸易战而推迟
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》周三报道，苹果和阿里巴巴在中国推出人工智能服务的计划被北京监管机构推迟。【原文：Apple and Alibaba's rollout of artificial intelligence services in China is being delayed by a Beijing regulator, the Financial Times reported on Wednesday.】
